Posted By: AngelxLegna (4/16/2010 9:29:42 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[I see what you did there](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=79090).  
  
Simply love this one, if i'm not mistaken that's the first rare land tutor ever aside from [Scapeshift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scapeshift), and even a pretty awesome one. And it's at least the first "plain" tutor so far.  
  
43\_land.dec will be very happy about this card. Now you have a new powerful ability to get lands in your graveyard, and this way there's even more card advantage through [Life from the Loam](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Life from the Loam).
posts.html:
I see what you did there.

Simply love this one, if i'm not mistaken that's the first rare land tutor ever aside from Scapeshift, and even a pretty awesome one. And it's at least the first "plain" tutor so far.

43_land.dec will be very happy about this card. Now you have a new powerful ability to get lands in your graveyard, and this way there's even more card advantage through Life from the Loam.

Posted By: Mode (4/19/2010 8:44:38 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is pretty good. In the land legacy deck it can be broken since it can be pretty hard to choose between tabernacle at Pendrell Vale, maze of ith, rift stone portal, and nantuko monastery or any other of the lands that can ruin your day depending on the match up, even glacial chasm would be hard to sort out. Overall this card is good in legacy and extended applications, highly abusable with a cruciable of worlds deck in extended that uses dark depths combo. Definitely a johnny card that can make you think outside the box.
posts.html:

Overall this card is good in legacy and extended applications, highly abusable with a cruciable of worlds deck in extended that uses dark depths combo. Definitely a johnny card that can make you think outside the box.

Posted By: ArturoB616 (4/21/2010 7:00:54 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
You guys are missing the point of this card! It's sick! You search for 4 different fetch lands! In one turn you've ripped 5 lands out of your deck, by turn 2 you've thinned your deck by 6 lands and helped make sure you have the right colors of land in play. This card by itself makes 5 color zoo, and several other potential 5 color decks even more sick.  
  
Personally I'm thinking [fist of the suns](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=fist of the suns) combined with  [Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Emrakul, the Aeons Torn) and several other cards to make a sick, sick deck.
posts.html:

In one turn you've ripped 5 lands out of your deck, by turn 2 you've thinned your deck by 6 lands and helped make sure you have the right colors of land in play. This card by itself makes 5 color zoo, and several other potential 5 color decks even more sick.

Personally I'm thinking fist of the suns combined with Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and several other cards to make a sick, sick deck.

posts.post_content: This card is decent if you have a few different types of land, as in [Tranquil Thickett](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tranquil Thickett), [Evolving Wilds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evolving Wilds), [Barren Moor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Barren Moor), and basic lands, but even so, it's situational.

posts.post_content: you guys are not seeing the point of this card. It thins out your deck by 4 land cards, which is huge...and serves as a great combo with [Knight of the Reliquary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of the Reliquary). Since it's instant speed you can also play it to give your knights +2/+2 so they survive a burn spell. 4.5/5.
